snippet: It seemed the moment when lawmakers would finally act on Illinois’s drastically underfinanced pension systems, but the moment came and went without a deal.
abstract: Illinois' lame-duck legislative session draws to close without deal on the state's drastically underfinanced pension system, squandering what would have been best chance to make a deal in the foreseeable future.

byline.contributor: Steven Yaccino contributed reporting from Chicago.

lead_paragraph: It seemed the moment when lawmakers would finally act on Illinois’s drastically underfinanced pension systems, but the moment came and went without a deal.

headline.main: Illinois Tries, and Fails, to Fix Its Pensions
headline.print_headline: Illinois Tries, and Fails, to Fix Its Pensions

keywords.value: Same-Sex Marriage, Civil Unions and Domestic Partnerships
